sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: A trapezoid has a height of 10 cm and two bases of lengths 25 cm and 15 cm. What is the area of this trapezoid?
message_2:
To find the area of a trapezoid, we can use the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (sum of the lengths of the bases) × height

In this case, the height is 10 cm, and the lengths of the bases are 25 cm and 15 cm. So, we can plug these values into the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (25 + 15) × 10

Area = (1/2) × 40 × 10

Area = 20 × 10

Area = 200 square centimeters

The area of the trapezoid is 200 square centimeters.
